title: Craftsmanship and Sabbath
shortSummary: Exodus 31 highlights God's appointment of skilled artisans Bezaleel and Aholiab to construct the tabernacle and its furnishings, empowered by the Spirit of God. The chapter also establishes the Sabbath as a perpetual covenant and a sign of sanctification between God and Israel, emphasizing rest and holiness.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus, during the wilderness journey after leaving Egypt

keyCharacters.name: Bezaleel
keyCharacters.description: A gifted craftsman from the tribe of Judah, filled with the Spirit of God to lead the artistic work on the tabernacle.

keyCharacters.name: Aholiab
keyCharacters.description: An artisan from the tribe of Dan who assisted Bezaleel and was given wisdom by God to help build the tabernacle and its furnishings.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who received God's commands and communicated them to the people, including instructions about the craftsmen and the Sabbath.

definitions.definition: The divine presence and power given by God to empower individuals with wisdom, understanding, and skill for His purposes.
The seventh day of the week set apart by God as a holy day of rest and worship, symbolizing God's sanctification of His people.
The gold cover on the Ark of the Covenant representing God's throne and presence, where He met with Moses.
An everlasting agreement established by God that continues through all generations, such as the Sabbath command.

outline.heading: Divine Appointment of Skilled Craftsmen
outline.description: God appoints Bezaleel and Aholiab, filling them with His Spirit to provide wisdom and skill for the construction of the tabernacle and its furnishings, demonstrating God's provision for His holy work.

outline.heading: Detailed Instructions for Tabernacle Furnishings
outline.description: The chapter lists the specific items to be made for worship, including the ark, mercy seat, table, candlestick, altars, and priestly garments, underscoring the importance of obedience to God's commands in worship.

outline.heading: The Sabbath as a Sign of Sanctification
outline.description: God commands Israel to keep the Sabbath holy as a perpetual covenant and a sign of their sanctification, with strict consequences for violation, linking rest to God's own rest after creation.

outline.heading: God’s Covenant Confirmed by the Tablets of Testimony
outline.description: God gives Moses two stone tablets written by His own finger, symbolizing the divine authority and permanence of the covenant laws including the Sabbath command.

application: Seek God’s wisdom and guidance through the Holy Spirit when undertaking tasks, recognizing that all skills and talents are gifts from Him.
Honor the Sabbath by setting aside regular time for rest and worship, remembering it as a sign of God’s sanctification and provision.
Obey God’s commands fully, understanding that His instructions are for our holiness and blessing.
Recognize the importance of consecrated work in service to God, offering our best efforts as an act of worship.

keyVerses.text: And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals that God empowers His servants with spiritual gifts and skills to accomplish His purposes.

keyVerses.text: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.
keyVerses.significance: It establishes the Sabbath as a perpetual sign of God’s sanctifying work in His people.

keyVerses.text: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.
keyVerses.significance: This verse connects the Sabbath rest to God’s own rest after creation, underscoring its divine origin and importance.

keyVerses.text: And he gave unto Moses, when he had made an end of communing with him upon mount Sinai, two tables of testimony, tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the divine authority of God’s covenant and the permanence of His law.
